when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used as a daytime greeting.
example: こんにちは！お元気ですか？ (konnichiwa! ogenki desu ka?) - Hello! How are you?

when_to_say: Used when parting for a long time.
example: さようなら、また会いましょう。 (sayounara, mata aimashou.) - Goodbye, let’s meet again.

when_to_say: Used as a morning greeting in casual situations.
example: おはよう！よく眠れた？ (ohayou! yoku nemureta?) - Good morning! Did you sleep well?

when_to_say: Used as a greeting in the evening.
example: こんばんは、いい夜ですね。 (konbanwa, ii yoru desu ne.) - Good evening, nice night isn’t it?

when_to_say: Used when asking for help or favor politely.
example: 助けてください、お願いします！ (tasukete kudasai, onegaishimasu!) - Please help me!

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道を教えてください。 (sumimasen, michi o oshiete kudasai.) - Excuse me, please tell me the way.

when_to_say: Used to affirm or agree.
example: はい、わかりました。 (hai, wakarimashita.) - Yes, I understand.

when_to_say: Used to disagree or deny something.
example: いいえ、違います。 (iie, chigaimasu.) - No, that’s wrong.

when_to_say: Used to say everything is fine or to reassure someone.
example: 大丈夫です、心配しないで。 (daijoubu desu, shinpai shinaide.) - I’m fine, don’t worry.

when_to_say: Used to describe beautiful people, places, or things.
example: この花は美しいです。 (kono hana wa utsukushii desu.) - This flower is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed of movement or action.
example: 彼は走るのが速い。 (kare wa hashiru no ga hayai.) - He runs fast.

when_to_say: Used when talking about learning or studying.
example: 毎日日本語を勉強します。 (mainichi nihongo o benkyou shimasu.) - I study Japanese every day.

when_to_say: Used to describe eating actions.
example: 一緒に昼ご飯を食べましょう。 (issho ni hirugohan o tabemashou.) - Let’s eat lunch together.

when_to_say: Used when talking about drinking liquids.
example: 水を飲みます。 (mizu o nomimasu.) - I drink water.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of running.
example: 毎朝公園で走ります。 (maiasa kouen de hashirimasu.) - I run in the park every morning.

when_to_say: Used when referring to watching or seeing something.
example: 映画を見るのが好きです。 (eiga o miru no ga suki desu.) - I like watching movies.

when_to_say: Used to describe writing activities.
example: 手紙を書いています。 (tegami o kaite imasu.) - I am writing a letter.

when_to_say: Used to describe speaking or conversing.
example: 日本語を話せますか？ (nihongo o hanasemasu ka?) - Can you speak Japanese?

when_to_say: Used when listening or asking questions.
example: 音楽を聞くのが好きです。 (ongaku o kiku no ga suki desu.) - I like listening to music.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a friend.
example: 彼は私の友達です。 (kare wa watashi no tomodachi desu.) - He is my friend.

when_to_say: Used to talk about one’s family.
example: 家族と旅行に行きます。 (kazoku to ryokou ni ikimasu.) - I go on a trip with my family.

when_to_say: Used when talking about time or duration.
example: 今は何時ですか？ (ima wa nanji desu ka?) - What time is it now?

when_to_say: Used to refer to school.
example: 学校に行きます。 (gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used to refer to teachers or respected professionals.
example: 先生、質問があります。 (sensei, shitsumon ga arimasu.) - Teacher, I have a question.

when_to_say: Used to describe something challenging.
example: この問題は難しいです。 (kono mondai wa muzukashii desu.) - This problem is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to describe something simple.
example: このテストは簡単です。 (kono tesuto wa kantan desu.) - This test is easy.

when_to_say: Used to describe fun experiences.
example: パーティーは楽しかった。 (paatii wa tanoshikatta.) - The party was fun.

when_to_say: Used to express sadness.
example: 悲しい映画を見ました。 (kanashii eiga o mimashita.) - I watched a sad movie.

when_to_say: Used to describe height or cost.
example: この店の服は高いです。 (kono mise no fuku wa takai desu.) - The clothes at this store are expensive.

when_to_say: Used to describe low cost.
example: この本は安いです。 (kono hon wa yasui desu.) - This book is cheap.

when_to_say: Used to describe large size.
example: 大きい犬がいます。 (ookii inu ga imasu.) - There is a big dog.

when_to_say: Used to describe small objects.
example: 小さい猫がかわいい。 (chiisai neko ga kawaii.) - The small cat is cute.

when_to_say: Used to describe blue color.
example: 青い空が好きです。 (aoi sora ga suki desu.) - I like the blue sky.

when_to_say: Used to describe red color.
example: 赤い花がきれいです。 (akai hana ga kirei desu.) - The red flower is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to describe black color.
example: 黒い靴を履きます。 (kuroi kutsu o hakimasu.) - I wear black shoes.

when_to_say: Used to describe white color.
example: 白いシャツが好きです。 (shiroi shatsu ga suki desu.) - I like white shirts.

when_to_say: Used when talking about weather.
example: 今日の天気はどうですか？ (kyou no tenki wa dou desu ka?) - How is the weather today?

when_to_say: Used when referring to rain.
example: 今日は雨が降っています。 (kyou wa ame ga futteimasu.) - It is raining today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to snow.
example: 雪がとてもきれいです。 (yuki ga totemo kirei desu.) - The snow is very beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather.
example: 今日はとても暑いです。 (kyou wa totemo atsui desu.) - It is very hot today.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather.
example: 冬は寒いです。 (fuyu wa samui desu.) - It is cold in winter.

when_to_say: Used when talking about shopping.
example: 新しい靴を買いました。 (atarashii kutsu o kaimashita.) - I bought new shoes.

when_to_say: Used when talking about selling items.
example: 店で野菜を売っています。 (mise de yasai o utteimasu.) - They sell vegetables at the store.

when_to_say: Used to describe reading actions.
example: 本を読むのが好きです。 (hon o yomu no ga suki desu.) - I like reading books.

when_to_say: Used to describe sleeping.
example: 早く寝ます。 (hayaku nemasu.) - I go to bed early.

when_to_say: Used to describe waking up.
example: 毎朝6時に起きます。 (maiasa rokuji ni okimasu.) - I wake up at 6 a.m. every morning.

when_to_say: Used when talking about working or jobs.
example: 会社で働いています。 (kaisha de hataraiteimasu.) - I work at a company.

when_to_say: Used to describe leisure or playing activities.
example: 友達と遊びました。 (tomodachi to asobimashita.) - I hung out with friends.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the act of studying.
example: 日本語の勉強が楽しいです。 (nihongo no benkyou ga tanoshii desu.) - Studying Japanese is fun.
